description: Building core infrastructure at an edtech startup that reaches 400,000+ monthly impressions.
I currently TA Introduction to Systems (CS0330), taught in C. I am a previous TA for Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithms (CS0200), taught in Java and Python.
I co-engineered Unity software for communicating and controlling SPOT robot arm motion intent through virtual reality headsets.

Cox Enterprises is a global conglomerate generating over $20B per year in primarily the media, automobile services, and telecommunications industries. I developed a serverless full-stack web application for Cox employees to register as Red Cross Blood Donor using React and AWS, wrote python scripts to reverse-engineer 1000+ lost investments data into SQL scripts, and created a high-level architecture strategy for M&A integrations.

Throughout 3 semesters, I consulted for a Fortune 15 telecommunications client, a healthcare startup, and the Chicago Public Library system. I led a team of 5 to assess the business opportunity of open access networks across North America for a Fortune 15 client (confidential) through geospatial analysis with ArcGIS and Tableau, and developed pitch decks to prepare the healthcare startup for Series A funding, and built out 15+ data visualizations and multiple Tableau dashboards for Chicago Public Library System to showcase key metrics and various demographics data of its 2.8 million patrons across 81 branches.

Treehouse Holdings is a private equity firm investing in early-stage companies in the healthcare and technology industries. I conducted various market analyses and legislation trend identifications and app testing.
